result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alfonso J Dorantes

records.addlTxt: -received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Clerk contacted the parties via email regarding Sentencing hearing. 
Per the Court's request and agreement of the parties, Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:30 am. 
Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
Information provided to Victim Witness Advocate.
-signed, filed, and distributed. Clerk provided copy to DOC.
Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Alfonso J Dorantes in Court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Lee Taylor and Attorney Amanda Joy Olsen in Court for Alfonso J Dorantes.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Jury Trial. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State complied with Victim Notification. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record, and confirmed by Defense and Defendant. 

STATE FILED AN AMENDED INFORMATION. Defense waived reading of the Amended Information, and temporarily entered a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of Defendant.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1: 
Defendant changed his plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to the plea, and advised of Constitutional Rights and maximum penalties. Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found Defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waived all his rights. Parties stipulated to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis for the plea. Court found Defendant GUILTY as charged in the Amended Information, and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

AS TO COUNT 2 AND COUNT 3: 
Pursuant to negotiations and on Motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 AND COUNT 3 DISMISSED BUT READ-IN for the purpose of Sentencing. 

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, or body armor. 
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.

Defense requested a Pre-Sentence Investigation (PSI). Court granted request. 

Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing hearing, Branch 46. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.  
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.

FILED: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum, and Elements of the Offense/Jury Instructions.

-received, filed, and distributed. Defense and Defendant received a copy. 

AS TO COUNT 1: On Motion of the State, Court ordered charge COUNT 1 AMENDED TO SECOND DEGREE RECKLESSLY ENDANGERING SAFETY, USE OF A DANGEROUS WEAPON, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes Section(s) 941.30(2), 939.50(3)(g), 939.63(1)(b) , a Class G Felony. 

AS TO COUNT 2 AND COUNT 3: Remains as originally charged.

Defendant Alfonso J Dorantes in Court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Lee Taylor in Court for Alfonso J Dorantes.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have NOT reached a resolution in this matter. State placed offer on the record. State addressed Motion in Limine. No additional issues need to be addressed at this time. Court ordered case adjourned for Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Jury Trial scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am in Room 113 of the Safety Building. ALL PARTIES MUST APPEAR IN-PERSON FOR FIRST CALL.
State's Witness List; received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine; received and filed.

Defendant Alfonso J Dorantes in Court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Lee Taylor in Court for Alfonso J Dorantes.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Defense requested a plea date. State to comply with Victim Notification. Court ordered case adjourned for Plea hearing, Branch 46.
Plea hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Alfonso J Dorantes in Court with Attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Alfonso J Dorantes in custody.  Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**  
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense has NOT received discovery material from the State. Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 10:00 am. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
Jury Trial scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Alfonso J Dorantes in court, appear by video with attorney Robert Lee Taylor, appear by video.  Defendant Alfonso J Dorantes in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judical notice to Kenosha County Case 19CF1623.  Sworn for the State:  MPD Officer J. Parlier.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alfonso J Dorantes in Court with Attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Alfonso J Dorantes in custody.  Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Order to Show Cause hearing. Parties appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Discussion placed on the record. Attorney Taylor was recently appointed by the Public Defender's Office. Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary hearing, Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

received and filed.
Attorney Robert Taylor.

Defendant Alfonso J Dorantes not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared by by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is GRANTED. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a STATE V-LEE Hearing in the trial court. Court date provided by Br. 46 Clerk  Hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Alfonso J Dorantes in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness persent. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alfonso J Dorantes not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Y.M.; J.J.M. and A.J.O.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Alfonso J Dorantes in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Alfonso J Dorantes in custody. Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Alfonso J Dorantes appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
